definition.title: What is a Guest Introduction?
definition.content: A guest introduction is a brief, polished script that hosts read to welcome you to their show or event. The best introductions hook the audience, establish your credibility, and create anticipation—all before you say a word.

tips: Start with an engaging hook - a question, statistic, or statement that captures attention
Establish credibility - highlight the most compelling credentials relevant to the topic
Connect to the audience - clarify why the guest and subject matter matter to listeners
End with a warm welcome - close with enthusiasm that transitions smoothly into conversation

examples.title: Podcast Guest Intro
examples.content: Have you ever wondered why some businesses scale effortlessly while others stay stuck? Today's guest has cracked the code. Sarah Chen has helped over 200 SaaS founders reach $1M ARR, and she's here to share the exact framework she uses. Please welcome Sarah Chen!

examples.title: Keynote Speaker Intro
examples.content: In a world where 80% of businesses fail within five years, our next speaker has built three successful exits. James Rivera is the author of 'Scale Smart' and has been featured in Forbes, Inc, and Entrepreneur. He's here to share the three decisions that make or break every business.

examples.title: Panel Introduction
examples.content: Our next panelist brings a unique perspective to today's discussion. Dr. Maya Patel has spent 15 years researching consumer behavior and advises Fortune 500 companies on market positioning. Welcome, Dr. Patel!

faq.question: What length should I choose?
faq.answer: Brief (30 sec) for fast-paced podcasts, standard (1 min) for most shows, and extended (2 min) for keynotes and formal events.

faq.question: How do I match the show's tone?
faq.answer: Listen to a few episodes to gauge the energy. Use energetic for upbeat shows, professional for business podcasts, and casual for conversational formats.

faq.question: Should I include my discussion topic?
faq.answer: Yes! Including your topic helps the host transition smoothly from your intro into the conversation.

faq.question: When should I send my intro to the host?
faq.answer: Send your intro at least 24 hours before the recording, along with any other materials like photos or links.
